head.title: SHARES FALL AT BIG FRENCH BANK

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: SHARES FALL AT BIG FRENCH BANK

abstract.p: Societe Generale, second-largest French bank, reports net of $689 million during second-quarter 2000, 6.7 percent above year-earlier period but far below 53 percent profit growth in first quarter; shares drop nearly 10 percent following report, to $57.94; graph (S)

block.p: Shares in the second-largest French bank, Societe Generale, dropped nearly 10 percent, to 65 euros, or about $57.94, after the bank reported disappointing second-quarter results. The bank earned 752 million euros or $689 million, up 6.7 percent from 705 million euros a year earlier, and far below the 53 percent profit growth in the first quarter. The bank's chairman, Daniel Bouton, said that the slowdown was a result of a ''seasonal element,'' but that the bank expected a significant profit gain for the full year.

Shares in the second-largest French bank, Societe Generale, dropped nearly 10 percent, to 65 euros, or about $57.94, after the bank reported disappointing second-quarter results. The bank earned 752 million euros or $689 million, up 6.7 percent from 705 million euros a year earlier, and far below the 53 percent profit growth in the first quarter. The bank's chairman, Daniel Bouton, said that the slowdown was a result of a ''seasonal element,'' but that the bank expected a significant profit gain for the full year.
